block.p: Joanna Celia Wexler and Michael Bard Bayer are to be married today by Rabbi Scott Corngold at the Harmonie Club in New York.

Mrs. Bayer, 30, is based in San Diego, selling antibiotics for Abbott Laboratories, the pharmaceuticals company. She graduated from the University of Southern California. Her father, Hannan Wexler of Larchmont, N.Y., is a marketing consultant. Her mother, Roberta Maneker of New York, is a marketing and public relations consultant and a former senior vice president for marketing at Christie's, the auction house. The bride's stepfather, Morton N. Maneker, retired as a partner in Proskauer Rose, the New York law firm.

Mr. Bayer, 34, works in San Diego as the director of music licensing for MP3.com, a Web site that offers digital-music files for downloading. He graduated from Duke University and received a law degree from the University of North Carolina. He is the son of Audrey Bayer and Robert T. Bayer of Asheville, N.C. His parents, who are retired, founded American Threshold Industries, a company in Asheville that makes surgical masks, gowns, sterile wraps and other disposable medical products.
